bacnet.util

Class BACnet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ptolemy.kernel.util.NamedObj
      • ptolemy.kernel.InstantiableNamedObj
        • ptolemy.kernel.Entity
          • ptolemy.kernel.ComponentEntity
            • ptolemy.actor.AtomicActor
              • ptolemy.actor.TypedAtomicActor
                • bacnet.util.BACnet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, ptolemy.actor.Actor, ptolemy.actor.Executable, ptolemy.actor.FiringsRecordable, ptolemy.actor.Initializable, ptolemy.actor.lib.SequenceActor, ptolemy.actor.TypedActor, ptolemy.kernel.util.Changeable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Debuggable, ptolemy.kernel.util.DebugListener, ptolemy.kernel.util.Derivable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Instantiable, ptolemy.kernel.util.ModelErrorHandler, ptolemy.kernel.util.MoMLExportable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Moveable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BACnetReader, BACnetWriter

    public abstract class BACnet
extends ptolemy.actor.TypedAtomicActor
implements ptolemy.actor.lib.SequenceActor
    This is an abstract base class for actors that generates an output stream. It is used by BACnetReader and BACnetWriter
    Author:
    Edward A. Lee, Steve Neuendorffer, modified by Zhengwei Li
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • BACnet

        public BACnet(ptolemy.kernel.CompositeEntity container,
              java.lang.String name)
       throws ptolemy.kernel.util.NameDuplicationException,
              ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Construct an actor with the given container and name.
        Parameters:
        container - The container.
        name - The name of this actor.
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If the actor cannot be contained by the proposed container.
        ptolemy.kernel.util.NameDuplicationException - If the container already has an actor with this name.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone(ptolemy.kernel.util.Workspace workspace)
                       throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Clone the actor into the specified workspace. This calls the base class and then resets the type constraints.
        Overrides:
        clone in class ptolemy.actor.AtomicActor
        Parameters:
        workspace - The workspace for the new object.
        Returns:
        A new actor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException - If a derived class contains an attribute that cannot be cloned.
        See Also:
        NamedObj.exportMoML(Writer, int, String), NamedObj.setDeferringChangeRequests(boolean)

      • setSchemaFileName

        protected abstract void setSchemaFileName()
        Abstract class that sets the schema file name. The class that implements this function needs to assign the variable schemaFileName

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
                throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Initialization section, initialize variiables and check possible errors.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ptolemy.actor.Initializable
        Overrides:
        initialize in class ptolemy.actor.AtomicActor
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if configuration file couldn't be found or if schema file couldnot be found or if operation system is Mac OS X or if BACnet-stack library hasnot been compiled.

      • checkConfFileExists

        public void checkConfFileExists()
                         throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Check if configuration file exists. This function is called by initialize().
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if file path is null or configuration file could not be found.

                              throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException

      • checkSchemaFileExists

        public void checkSchemaFileExists()
                           throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Check if schema file exists. This function is called in initialize().
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if schema file couldn't be found.

      • readXMLConfigurationFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<BACnetObjectType> readXMLConfigurationFile()
                                                               throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Read the xml configuration file, store the elements to BACnetObjectType ArrayList. This function is called by initialize(). (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter)
        Returns:
        ArrayList of BACnetObjectType
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if either SAXException or ParserConfiguration Exception has been caught.

      • readDeviceArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> readDeviceArray()
                                                       throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Read the device array from the configuration file. This function is called by initialize(). (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter)
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing device instance integers
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if error occurs while reading configuration file.

      • checkConnection

        public void checkConnection()
                     throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Check if the connection is lost. This function is called by validateDevice()
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if connection with BACnetDevice is lost.

      • validateDevice

        public void validateDevice()
                    throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        validate device specified in configuration file. This function is called in initialize(). (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if device instance is not an integer or cannot be found in the network.

      • validateObjectType

        public void validateObjectType()
                        throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Validate Object Type. This function is called by initialize(). (See BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if one object type in configuration file is not part of the standard or if the object instance number is not integer.

      • validatePropertyName

        public void validatePropertyName()
                          throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Validate property name. This function is called by initialize(). (See BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if property name is not part of the standard.

      • validateAttributes

        public void validateAttributes()
                        throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Validate application tag, priority and index. This function is called by initialize(). (See BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if the application tag is not part of the BACnet standard, or the priority or the index is not an integer.

      • readDevicePropertyArray

        public java.util.ArrayList<BACnetCompleteProperty> readDevicePropertyArray()
                                                                    throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Read all properties listed in the configuration file. This file is called by initialize() (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Returns:
        ArrayList of BACnetCompleteProperty of all the properties in the configuration file.
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if the device or object instance number is not integer.

      • storeDataInLastTimeStep

        public void storeDataInLastTimeStep()
        Store response from last time step. This function is called in prepareTokensToSend().

      • executeProcess

        public void executeProcess(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.ProcessBuilder> process_arr)
                    throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Execute Processes, store results to consoleoutput_arr and exitvalue-arr. This function is called in fire(), (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if error occurs and continueWhenError is false.

      • transformArrayList

        public ptolemy.data.Token[] transformArrayList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> data_str)
        Transform String Arraylist to Token Arrays. This function is called in prepareTokensToSend().

      • prepareTokensToSend

        public void prepareTokensToSend()
                         throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Get tokens to send for the next timestep. This function is called in fire(), (see BACnetReader and BACnetWriter).
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if erros occur in executeProcess.

      • sendToken

        public void sendToken()
               throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Sends the error signal to the errorSignal port, the error message to the errorMessage port, and the console output to the consoleArr. This function is called by fire().
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException

      • validateSyntax

        public void validateSyntax()
                    throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Validate xml configuration file syntax. This function is called in initialze().
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - if configuration file couldn't be found or syntax is against the schema file.

      • removeToken

        public void removeToken()
                 throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
        Remove tokens in previous time step. This function is called by the fire() method of the BACnetReader and BACnetWriter.
        Throws:
        ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
